sourceDesc.p: Researched and written by Christopher Morrison, March 2008

div.head: Summary
div.p: The United States recognized Mauritius on March 12, 1968, when the American Embassy at Port Louis was established upon Mauritius’ attainment of independence on that same date.

div.head: U.S. Recognition of Mauritius’ Independence, 1968.
div.p: The United States recognized Mauritius on March 12, 1968, when the American Embassy at Port Louis was established upon Mauritius’ attainment of independence on that same date. Mauritius previously had been under British sovereignty.

div.head: Establishment of Diplomatic Relations and the American Embassy in Mauritius, 1968.
div.p: Diplomatic relations were established on March 12, 1968, when the American Embassy at Port Louis was established with William B. Hussey as Chargé d’Affaires at interim.
